user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_get_connection_values:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN int
MHD_get_connection_values (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                           enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                           MHD_KeyValueIterator iterator,
                           void *iterator_cls)
{
  int ret;
  struct MHD_HTTP_Req_Header *pos;

  if (NULL == connection)
    return -1;
  ret = 0;
  for (pos = connection->rq.headers_received; NULL != pos; pos = pos->next)
    if (0 != (pos->kind & kind))
    {
      ret++;
      if ( (NULL != iterator) &&
           (MHD_NO == iterator (iterator_cls,
                                pos->kind,
                                pos->header,
                                pos->value)) )
        return ret;
    }
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (0 != (pos->kind & kind))
    {
      ret++;
      if ( (NULL != iterator) &&
           (MHD_NO == iterator (iterator_cls,
                                pos->kind,
                                pos->header,
                                pos->value)) )
        return ret;
    }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The fragment contains no permanently unreachable code: if (0 != (pos->kind & kind)) can be true at runtime; if iterator is non-NULL and iterator(...) returns MHD_NO the inner return ret; is executed. Otherwise control continues and the final return ret; after the loop is reached. All branches are reachable depending on runtime values.
